channel.title: The Biggest, Most Realistic, Most Detailed, Most Role-play Server Ever
channel.description:
[b]The Vision[/b] Imagine a server, where every click means something. Every step taken has a consequence. To live a story, your own story, as a being of many sorts, which simulates real-life (with a fantasy-medieval twist, of course). [i]One life[/i].
Forget about the traditional point, click and wait combat. Forget the skill and grind aspect we all know. Take the skin of a game that is familiar to us all, rip it's guts out and give it a new heart. This is what you get.
Once you log in you are born, figuratively speaking. Decide what you want to be and the rest is up to you. Law-abiding citizen, a crazy nomad wizard, dragon-slaying hero, or maybe a law-upholding kingsman? Go find some Vampires and live the cursed life (I know you secretly fantasise about it). The possibilities really are endless.
Every action has a re-action. Murder, stealing, tax evasion and choosing to be rude in dialogue has its consequences. Even down to the small details like eating food and simply using coins will effect your character in some way. Everything is documented so you will know what you can do.
Choose your style of play, whether it be heroic, evil, a bit of both or something in between, you get to decide everything. But die, through being killed or, if you are boring, old age, and your account will literally remain dead. Your gravestone will be placed near your location and you may even go down in the history books.
Still not convinced this is the game for you? That's fine, I know it won't be everyone's cup of tea, but let me give you some insight on a few misconceptions that might persuade you otherwise.
[b]Misconceptions/FAQ[/b]
[b]Some Features That Were Planned at the Beginning of This Thread (some ideas may have changed, been added or removed)[/b] [url=http://pastebin.com/EA2JjfwU]http://pastebin.com/EA2JjfwU[/url]
[b]Information[/b]
Development has begun. Currently collecting data.
[img]http://puu.sh/gd3Ro/62a7616eba.png[/img]
[b]About/Credits[/b] In the end, the poll as to what base to use was in favour of the old school Arios 498 project as opposed to the 718 loading 742. But then someone suggested to me to use a 317 framework and it made me think. After a day, I decided this would be my best option as I could write all the content from scratch and wouldn't have to worry about building off of an unfamiliar system or having to clean the source first. So I chose lare96's Asteria 2.0 project.
I am creating this server for no one else but myself, so when you ask why, why not? Collaborating ideas and collecting data as I go. Some days may even be purely preparation and not actual development in code. I also would love to discuss with you concepts, ways to implement systems and ways to make the entire game involving, interactive and immersive regarding a RuneScape-style world, so please strike up a conversation with me at any time.
I have one rule. Talk to me as players (not developers). What do you like and dislike in games such as RuneScape, and all other simulation or RPG types.
I'm not here to revolutionise RuneScape Private Servers. I want to change the idea completely.
[i]Credits to the following[/i] -lare96 for his Asteria 2.0 base

item.title: The Biggest, Most Realistic, Most Detailed, Most Role-play Server Ever
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

[quote=“planetrsps, post:32, topic:549967”]Development has officially begun. At the moment I am collecting various data and familiarsing myself with the framework that I have chosen. In the end the poll favoured the old school Arios 498 vote, but some people suggested to use an old school 317 framework instead, and after giving it some thought, I decided that this would be my best option. So I chose lare96’s Asteria 2.0 project.

Thanks to everyone who voted. It was a hard decision, but an important one, and you all helped clarify to me what would best suit the server. The pros of using Asteria 2.0 is that it has combat and all core features which will save me a lot of time (no point re-inventing the wheel). It comes clean with no skills so I can happily build my own systems with nothing else to get in my way.

Long road ahead now. Features will be updated as they are completed.

Opinions on the time scale?

1 minute in-game (1 second irl)
60 minutes in-game equals 1 hour in-game (60 seconds irl)
1440 minutes in-game equals 24 hours in-game (24 minutes irl)
24 hours in-game equals 1 day in-game (24 minutes irl)
7 days in-game equals 1 week in-game (2 hours 48 minutes irl)
52 weeks in-game equals 1 year in-game (145 hours 31 minutes or 6 days 1 hour irl)

Life expentancy in Medieval Britain was 64

64 years with no enhancements (388 days irl).

IDEAS

-Wizard potion that permanently extends life expectancy by up to 50%
-Wizard potion that gives a second life ONCE and only once (rare occurence)

Edit:
Progress Update.

So what I am doing right now is converting everything in my head to code for when players first log in. Things can always be improved visually, and maybe custom interfaces once I look into doing that.

I had to find a way of restricting beards and certain hair colours upon character design, so instead of using interface 3559 I had to use a different type of menu system that prevents this.








[/quote]

you don’t need to do that, you can still use the appearance interface, just make a few amendments to the appearance packet. for example, certain colors and values are stored in arrays… so just return if they’re invalid.

to stop beards for example:

if(data[1] >= 1) { player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You can't choose a beard!"); return; }

or even certain values whilst being a female:

if (i < 7 && !(data[i] >= VALID_VALUES[i][0] && data[i] <= VALID_VALUES[i][1]) && gender == 1) { player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You can't choose this appearance whilst being a female."); return; }

Read full topic

64 years with no enhancements (388 days irl).

Edit:
Progress Update.

So what I am doing right now is converting everything in my head to code for when players first log in. Things can always be improved visually, and maybe custom interfaces once I look into doing that.

item.title: The Biggest, Most Realistic, Most Detailed, Most Role-play Server Ever
item.dc:creator: @planetrsps planetrsps
item.description:
@planetrsps wrote:

Yeah on second thought, good or bad genes wouldn’t be a fair system. Diet is something every player has control over though and in a game small details count to me. That would be a fairly simple system in my eyes. Just store a number for each player and for every food considered good for you increment it for every food that is considered bad, decrement it. You wouldn’t be able to spam eat because you would become full and vomit.

Read full topic
item.source: The Biggest, Most Realistic, Most Detailed, Most Role-play Server Ever

item.title: The Biggest, Most Realistic, Most Detailed, Most Role-play Server Ever
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:23, topic:549967”][quote author=Si Force link=topic=668847.msg4473497#msg4473497 date=1424462801]
I don’t see the point in a time-defined high score if there’s a set limit to how long your character will survive. I could become a hermit and do nothing more dangerous than bake some bread and I’d become number one. You’re going to have to be more creative than that.
[/quote]

Rains
You get dysentery
Die while baking bread[/quote]

You just ruined my life dream.

[quote=“planetrsps, post:24, topic:549967”][quote author=Si Force link=topic=668847.msg4473497#msg4473497 date=1424462801]
I don’t see the point in a time-defined high score if there’s a set limit to how long your character will survive. I could become a hermit and do nothing more dangerous than bake some bread and I’d become number one. You’re going to have to be more creative than that.
[/quote]

There are ways to prolong your life as it is a magical land. Wizards and herblorists can conjure potions is one example.

Others could be you are just lucky to have good genes and live longer than the average. Your diet might help you live longer. Even a rare potion that gives you a one off resurrection that must be used wisely. There are plenty of ways to counter any game-play issues.

This is exactly what I hoped for too. Because everything people say that won’t work, I can then find ways for it to work. It’s problem solving and a big part of game development is about that.[/quote]

It’s good that you can problem solve, however making your solutions too complex won’t do you any favors. Plus it doesn’t seem very fair that one player can have better genes than the next and they don’t have any control over that. I’d steer clear of a system like that, it just adds unnecessary complexity. Diet is a good idea, however implementing that sounds like a small pain for what it’s worth.

Read full topic

item.title: The Biggest, Most Realistic, Most Detailed, Most Role-play Server Ever
item.dc:creator: @planetrsps planetrsps
item.description:
@planetrsps wrote:

Si Force:

I don’t see the point in a time-defined high score if there’s a set limit to how long your character will survive. I could become a hermit and do nothing more dangerous than bake some bread and I’d become number one. You’re going to have to be more creative than that.

There are ways to prolong your life as it is a magical land. Wizards and herblorists can conjure potions is one example.

Others could be you are just lucky to have good genes and live longer than the average. Your diet might help you live longer. Even a rare potion that gives you a one off resurrection that must be used wisely. There are plenty of ways to counter any game-play issues.

This is exactly what I hoped for too. Because everything people say that won’t work, I can then find ways for it to work. It’s problem solving and a big part of game development is about that.

item.title: The Biggest, Most Realistic, Most Detailed, Most Role-play Server Ever
item.dc:creator: @planetrsps planetrsps
item.description:
@planetrsps wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:19, topic:549967”]have you ever been fishing lol. shark fishing is very common and easy tbh.

and its not a highscore if your character can RANDOMLY die

this isnt sims. its runescape.
the amount of things needed to be rewritten/the overhaul isnt gonna be worth it for the lack of players in the end.

also “in a couple years” why the hell is it in the showoff section if no development has been done?[/quote]

Because brainstorming, discussing ways to implement the mechanics and taking the time to know what revision would best suit is part of the development.

Also, think of the highscores of PacMan. It shows who perservered and survived the longest. That is what this highscore will be about. There could also be highscores for most jobs had, most near death experiences, most food eaten. Just random fun things.

You’ve got to remember that if I took two years to do this it might not necessarily be worth it for you, but it would be worth it for me. It’s for my own satisfaction.

Read full topic

item.title: The Biggest, Most Realistic, Most Detailed, Most Role-play Server Ever
item.dc:creator: @planetrsps planetrsps
item.description:
@planetrsps wrote:

Players would compete for a highscore to see who can live the longest. Also I don’t know if you think skilling would still mean standing at a bank fletching 5k yew logs into bows but it will be nothing like that. As I said in my previous reply to you, grinding won’t really be an aspect.

Skilling will be based on experience rather than levels. Meaning theorectically you could fish sharks at level 1 but how many people do you know who have never been fishing before that could catch a shark? It’s all about the experience you have. You would nearly always fail. This is the basic overview of how “skilling” would work.

The difference is that you would be playing out a virtual life so unless you wanted a career in fishing, you would not be standing around for 10 hours catching lobsters. You would probably go out and catch your dinner and then move on to something else. The universal energy system will see that you cannot grind for hours and hours because you would be too exhausted. To balance this, it will be easy to “level” (need to find a use for levels) but if you leave something too long you become rusty and lose experience.

I stated in the first post that I am developing this purely for myself primarily. Of course, anyone who wants to play it, can. It will be designed to be playable whether there are 3 or 300 players online. The less players online, the more npcs will fill player’s roles. Then when more players come, they can take over the roles (shop keepers, guards etc.).

I do think a lot of people would say “I wouldn’t want to play this because if I die I would waste my time” because they can only imagine it through the way current RSPS works. I reckon in a couple of years once this hits Alpha stages I could change your mind.

Read full topic
item.source: The Biggest, Most Realistic, Most Detailed, Most Role-play Server Ever

item.title: The Biggest, Most Realistic, Most Detailed, Most Role-play Server Ever
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:16, topic:549967”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=668847.msg4473000#msg4473000 date=1424182713]
nobody’s gonna grind an rsps to that they can die at any time and not be able to play again
[/quote]
This. I wouldn’t play a realistic server if I wanted to chill out one day. You need to realize these ideas will only seem fun to you, while others will admit it to be unique. Not worth playing though, because I wouldn’t want to play some sort of a storyline on a rsps that I just log in to chill out one day.

You’re missing the RuneScape aspect of this.[/quote]i wasnt even referring to that.

op states players can die randomly at any moment. and once dead its over.

people play hardcore because they know what to avoid and where to go to prevent death and losing all their hardwork.

i doubt anyone would grind out a server just to have their account doe of old age or sickness whilst skilling.

its “unique” sure. but all rather stupid.

Read full topic
